p: According to the China Notifiable Disease Surveillance System, 49 290 local DF cases occurred in China between 2010 and 2014, with those in the PRD and BYM accounting for 97.06%. Figure 4 shows that the DF epidemic had obvious seasonal characteristics. The epidemic was mainly concentrated in July to November, accounting for 99.95% of the annual cases, and reached the peak incidence from August to October. In these 5 years, there were 46 422 and 1419 local DF cases in the PRD and BYM, respectively, showing an increasing trend in successive years. From 2010 to 2012, there were fewer than 500 local cases, and the number of cases in 2013 and 2014 surged to 4000 and 40 000, respectively, with the BYM exhibiting a large-scale epidemic in 2013.
